thread.title: Eagles force 3 turnovers, lurch to halftime lead
thread.title_full: Eagles force 3 turnovers, lurch to halftime lead

author: Les Bowen
title: Eagles force 3 turnovers, lurch to halftime lead
text:
Eagles Eagles force 3 turnovers, lurch to halftime lead The Eagles weren't smooth offensively, but their defense rounded into form to push them toward a 17-7 halftime lead. Eagles force 3 turnovers, lurch to halftime lead Eagles tight end Zach Ertz is tackled by Giants middle linebacker Uani' Unga and free safety Landon Collins. (Matt Rourke/AP) Travel Deals Les Bowen Posted: Monday, October 19, 2015, 10:19 PM 
Despite an offense that lurched and shuddered, the Eagles entered halftime with a 17-7 lead over the NFC East rival New York Giants, thanks to three turnovers by the visitors, who equaled their total for the season entering the game. 
The Giants’ opening-series touchdown drive looked ominously easy. They drove 80 yards in eight plays with one Eagles penalty, never even facing third down, mixing runs and short passes. Many of the passes were to the middle of the field, where they found extraordinary amounts of room. 
The touchdown pass to Odell Beckham Jr. covered 18 yards. Beckham went down at the 2, but no one was close enough to touch him – Chris Maragos was closest – and he rolled into the end zone. His much-discussed hamstring seemed to run and roll just fine. Beckham finished the half with 7 catches for 61 yards. 
Eli Manning jogged off the field for the first time 5 for 5 for 59 yards and a TD. At halftime, he was 18 for 25 for 162, the TD and two picks. More coverage SHOP: Eagles Training Camp sportswear 
The Giants were driving again when DeMeco Ryans wrestled a pass away from tight end Larry Donnell, giving the Birds the ball at their 22. They needed a roughing-the-passer call on Damontre Moore to get their initial first down of the game, but then they clicked into gear. Seven plays, 78 yards, capped by a 32-yard Sam Bradford pass to Riley Cooper tied the score with 3:33 left in the first. 
The Eagles took the lead on another turnover. Manning equaled his 2015 interception total entering the game, when he flung the ball toward Dwayne Harris at the sideline but found Nolan Carroll, who stepped in front and pranced into the end zone for the easiest 17-yard touchdown of his career. 
The Giants were moving again, aided by a phantom roughing penalty on Cedric Thornton, when Malcolm Jenkins poked the ball out of Rashad Jennings’ grasp and Ryans recovered, just before leaving the game with a hamstring problem. So the Giants doubled their 2015 turnover total in the first 19 minutes, 26 seconds. 
The Eagles gave it right back, though, on a Bradford overthrow of Zach Ertz that went right into the midsection of Jayron Hosley. 
The Eagles got their final three points of the half on a 37-yard Caleb Sturgis field goal.
